name: DSIP (Delta Sleep-Inducing Peptide)
description: A neuropeptide originally isolated from rabbit brain that promotes delta wave sleep. Research suggests roles in stress modulation, pain perception, and endocrine regulation. Limited but intriguing clinical data from European studies.

dosage.notes: Short half-life. Typically used for 2-4 week cycles. Intranasal or subcutaneous.

keyFindings: Improved sleep architecture and increased delta wave sleep in clinical studies
Normalized disturbed sleep patterns without next-day sedation
Showed stress-protective and analgesic properties in animal models
interactions: May potentiate sedatives and sleep medications
